intro: Brassica rapa subsp. campestris, commonly known as field mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant has alternate, pinnately lobed leaves and produces yellow flowers in racemes. Its fruits are short, cylindrical siliques that contain several seeds. It is native to Europe and Asia but has been naturalized in many parts of the world.
